post:
AlphaVPS – €3.60/512MB and €5/1GB OpenVZ VPS in Bulgaria, LiquidHost offer inside

March 17, 2014 @ 7:30 am, by Maarten Kossen

Alexander, from LiquidHost, has sent in several offers for his new brand: AlphaVPS! AlphaVPS is a separate company from LiquidHost and is a joint project of him and a friend, who both own 50%. The company is a legally registered entity in Bulgaria as DA International group Ltd. The goal of AlphaVPS is to offer ‘affordable and reliable, top-grade VPS in Bulgaria’. AlphaVPS offers native IPv6 and has its servers located in the Telepoint DC in Sofia, Bulgaria. For their launch, they have created the coupon code ‘LaunchiiingLEB’ which gives 40% discount on all their packages. This offers also includes three offers from LiquidHost, but more about that later. Feel free to share your experiences with both companies here or at LowEndTalk.com!

AlphaVPS Level 1

  • 512MB RAM
  • 1 CPU Core (shared)
  • 20GB disk space
  • 200GB bandwidth
  • 1x IPv4 address
  • IPv6 on request
  • 1Gbit uplink
  • OpenVZ/SolusVM
  • Coupon: LaunchiiingLEB
  • €3.6/month – ~$5/month
  • Order here
AlphaVPS Level 2

  • 1GB RAM
  • 1 CPU Core (shared)
  • 20GB disk space
  • 150GB bandwidth
  • 1x IPv4 address
  • IPv6 on request
  • 1Gbit uplink
  • OpenVZ/SolusVM
  • Coupon: under7dollars
  • €5/month – ~$7/month
  • Order here

More offers inside!

AlphaVPS accepts payments via PayPal only. They have a no-refund policy in place, though they do note that refunds will be considered on a case-by-case basis. AlphaVPS requires a 14-day notice for cancellations. No illegal activity is allowed and the authorities may be informed in case you are caught doing anything that’s not allowed in Bulgaria. For more information, please read their Terms of Service!

Network information

Sofia, Bulgaria
Looking glass: http://lg.alphavps.bg

And now… on to Liquidhost! This is Alexander’s own company, which is now a legally registered entity in Bulgaria, registered as Cyber Layer Ltd. LiquidHost offers native IPv6 in Lenoir, and tunneled IPv6 is available on request in other locations. DDoS protection is now available in Chicago: for $3/month or $24/year, your IP is protected against attacks up to 10Gbps. Alexander notes he has recently hired two additional staff members to cover the support load.

LH 3GB Special

  • 3GB RAM
  • 120GB Disk Space
  • 800GB Bandwidth
  • 1x IPv4 address
  • 100Mbit uplink
  • OpenVZ/SolusVM
  • Chicago, Illinois
  • $7/Month: Order
  • $48/Year: Order
LH 2GB Special

  • 2GB RAM
  • 1GB vSwap
  • 100GB Disk Space
  • 800GB Bandwidth
  • 1x IPv4 address
  • 100Mbit uplink
  • OpenVZ/SolusVM
  • $7/Month: Los Angeles
  • Seattle | Lenoir
  • $48/Year: Los Angeles
  • Seattle | Lenoir
LH LEB 256

  • 256MB RAM
  • 128MB vSwap
  • 20GB Disk space
  • 150GB Bandwidth
  • 1x IPv4 address
  • 100Mbit uplink
  • OpenVZ/SolusVM
  • $15/Year
  • Order in Seattle
  • Order in Chicago

Liquid Solutions accept payments through Credit and Debit Cards via PayPal. They operate with a fairly strict non-refund policy. Their ToS allows fair use of their shared resources which are IO and CPU, so if you don’t go overboard you should be fine. Among their list of addons they have up to 5-10Gbit UDP and TCP flood protection on peaks for $3/month/IPv4 (available in Chicago), internal IP’s for complex setups and with traffic not being counted, free offsite backup available on request and “DNS services.” Anything illegal in the US is not allowed, as per their current Terms of Service.
